title: Chinese Culinary Terms
description: Discover the vocabulary of Chinese cooking, from dim sum to wok techniques

questions.question: In Chinese cuisine, what does 'dim sum' literally translate to?
options: Touch the heart — referring to small, bite-sized dishes

questions.question: What is 'wok hei' in Chinese cooking?
options: The smoky, charred flavor achieved from high-heat wok cooking

questions.question: In Chinese cuisine, what is 'hoisin' sauce?
options: A thick, fragrant sweet and savory sauce often used with Peking duck

questions.question: What are 'bao' (or 'baozi') in Chinese food?
options: Steamed filled buns, often stuffed with meat or sweet paste

questions.question: What does 'kung pao' refer to in the dish 'kung pao chicken'?
options: A title meaning 'palace guardian,' named after a Qing dynasty official

questions.question: In Chinese cooking, what is 'doubanjiang'?
options: A spicy, fermented broad bean and chili paste from Sichuan province

questions.question: What does 'char siu' mean in Chinese food terminology?
options: Fork-roasted — Cantonese-style barbecued pork with a sweet glaze

questions.question: What is 'congee' (also called 'jook') in Chinese cuisine?
options: A thick rice porridge often served for breakfast or as comfort food

questions.question: In Chinese cooking, what does 'jiaozi' refer to?
options: Crescent-shaped dumplings typically filled with meat and vegetables

questions.question: What is 'five-spice powder' (wu xiang fen) in Chinese cuisine?
options: A blend typically of star anise, cloves, cinnamon, Sichuan pepper, and fennel seeds

questions.question: What does 'lo mein' literally translate to?
options: Tossed noodles — noodles mixed with sauce rather than stir-fried

questions.question: In Chinese cuisine, what is 'tofu' (doufu) made from?
options: Coagulated soy milk pressed into blocks

questions.question: What is 'xiao long bao' in Chinese food?
options: Soup dumplings — small buns filled with meat and hot broth

questions.question: What does 'ma la' describe in Sichuan cuisine?
options: Numbing and spicy — the signature flavor from Sichuan peppercorns and chili
